item.title: This Week in Gaming: Black Flag, Splinter Cell, And Everything You Missed
item.content:encoded:
With the holiday season approaching, things are starting to pick up in the gaming world. And with that means the news is coming in hot and heavy every week. With that, though, means there’s like some gaming news you might have missed this week. Luckily, Insider Gaming is here to catch you up on some of the biggest stories of the week along with some that may have flown under the radar.

There was a new Splinter Cell in development, but Ubisoft reportedly turned it into xDefiant, and we have a firm window on the Assassin’s Creed Black Flag Remake release. On the awards front, The Game Awards announced their nominees for 2025, and the 43rd Annual Golden Joystick Awards were held this week.

Elsewhere, Concord has been shut down a second time and Hytale is back after being bought out by its creator, Hypixel. All these stories and more in your Insider Gaming weekly recap.

The Gaming News You Missed

Below you’ll find some of the biggest stories of the week along with other stories that flew under the radar that you should know. If there’s anything else you think should be included, let us know in the comments. You can also talk about the news and more in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

A New Splinter Cell Was in Development, But Ubisoft Canceled It

Ubisoft was working on a new entry in the Splinter Cell franchise, but Ubisoft decided to cancel it before it was ever announced.

In a recent interview with Bloomberg’s Jason Schreier, AdHoc Studio co-founder Nick Herman spoke about how Dispatch came to be and an interesting situation that led to the studio’s formation.

Herman was hired in 2017 by Ubisoft, along two other AdHoc cofounders Pierre Shorette and Dennis Lenart, and moved to work in Ubisoft’s San Francisco office. Upon arrival, they were put on the new Splinter Cell project.

FULL STORY…

EXCLUSIVE: Assassin’s Creed Black Flag Remake Set to Launch Before March 31

The Assassin’s Creed Black Flag remake is one of the most talked-about games within the Ubisoft machine, but until now, it hasn’t been formally acknowledged by the company. However, Insider Gaming has covered the game extensively over the past 18 months and has now learned that it’s set to launch before March 31, 2026.

This exclusive news comes as Ubisoft publishes the delayed financial update deck that was pushed back and went hand-in-hand with a halt on trading, fueling speculation about the company’s future.

There’s even a specific window fans should expect to see the game.

FULL STORY…

Xbox Doubles Down on Next-Gen Console and Calls It a ‘Powerful Experience’

In a recent video published by Fortune, Xbox President Sarah Bond spoke about the next-generation Xbox console, which has long been a point of debate and contention amongst gamers. Some believe Xbox is getting out of hardware, while die-hard fans are fully preparing to stump up the cash for whatever comes next.

Sarah Bond insists that the next Xbox will offer a ‘powerful experience’ that will be portable and accessible across multiple platforms, going with players ‘everywhere they go’.

FULL STORY…

Golden Joystick Awards 2025 – All Award Winners

On November 20, the Golden Joystick Awards 2025 took place in London, and there was no shortage of awards to be given out to the various winners this year.

It’s the 43nd-Annual edition of the Golden Joystick Awards, and it featured 24 awards and dozens of games both large and small sharing the stage for the show. Nearly all of the awards are voted on by the fans with just four being decided by a panel of critics and creators. Those four awards are: Streamers’ Choice, Breakthrough, Critics’ Choice, and Lifetime Achievement.

Check out the full list of award nominees and winners.

FULL STORY…

The Game Awards 2025—All Award Nominees

The nominees for The Game Awards 2025 have been announced. For more than a decade, the show, hosted by Geoff Keighley, celebrates the year’s best games and highlights the future of the industry. With 2025 being as great a year for game releases, there were already some tight competition. Now, we know just what stood out for outlets and the judges.

All of the categories were voted on by a panel of judges from various outlets. The winners are mostly chosen by that group, but fans can vote for their favorites on the site as well. However, the biggest category that’s fully fan-voted is Player’s Voice. Nominations for the category will be announced at a later date. Last year, Astro Bot won Game of the Year, with Metaphor: ReFantazio and Balatro winning several awards as well.

Check out the full list of 2025’s nominees. 

FULL STORY…

Battlefield 6 Breaks Franchise Sales Record

In what may sound obvious at this point, Electronic Arts (EA) has found itself a hit with Battlefield 6. In the latest United States (US) sales report from Circana, Battlefield 6 has it a major sales record for the franchise.

According to the data provided, Battlefield 6 is the best-selling game in series history. It’s sales alone in October not only made it the best-selling game of both the month and year, but also saw it surpass the lifetime sales of Battlefield 1. Up until this year, Battlefield 1 had been the highest-selling game every for Battlefield.

But that’s not all.

FULL STORY…

Hytale Is Back After Being Reacquired By Hypixel Studios

Hypixel Studios is back, and they have brought an old friend along with it. On Monday, founder Simon Collins-Laflamme announced that they had reacquired the rights to sandbox game Hytale from Riot Games.

The news comes roughly five months since it was announced that the game was being shut down.

FULL STORY…

Concord Has Effectively Been Shut Down By Sony For A Second Time

Concord has gone down in infamy as an all-time Sony and PlayStation blunder. It’s also understandable that the company wants to sweep the game’s existence under the rug, which is why Sony has presumably and swiftly issued DMCAs notices to gameplay videos of a fan-inspired Concord reboot, causing access to the game to be halted.

Now, a community effort to resurrect the game has been met with strong action.

FULL STORY…

Star Citizen Hits 13 Years of Development & Nearly $900 Million In Funding, And It’s Still In Alpha

The long road to Star Citizen’s full release looks to be continuing, as it’s been 13 years since the game was announced. We’ve checked back in from time to time, and the latest update is that Star Citizen is still in alpha, and it’s swiftly closing in on $900 million of crowd-funded money.

Say what you want, yes, but Star Citizen actually looks like a quality game. On the other hand, it probably should do when it’s had the development time that many multi-game franchises get and enough money to fund several Hollywood-level movies. Cloud Imperium Games’ Star Citizen could end up being one of the most fascinating games of our time.

FULL STORY…

Resident Evil Requiem Producer Addresses Leon Kennedy Rumors

In an interview with stevivor, Resident Evil Requiem producer Masato Kumazawa opened up on the upcoming sequel.

It should be noted that Kumazawa’s responses were translated via an interpreter. While we don’t discredit the translator, there’s always the possibility that something was lost in translation. But when asked about the future of Leon Kennedy and the rumors that he might be in Resident Evil Requiem, Kumazawa had a simple response…

FULL STORY…

The Weekly Gaming News Recap

While this is some of the gaming news you may have missed, there’s still plenty of news across the games industry. To catch up on all of the latest news you need to know, check out Insider Gaming’s news archives.

If you want even more gaming news at your finger tips, download the official Insider Gaming App. The app is available for free on Google Play with an iOS version coming soon.

MOBILE APP

Level Up Your Gaming News

Real-time news, exclusive podcasts, push alerts, and a better reading experience.

Available on Android



https://insider-gaming.com/this-week-in-gaming-news-november-21/

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket Next Set Release Details—New Set B1a, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Even though the developers seem to be listening, Pokémon TCG Pocket content is still coming thick and fast. Set B1a will be here before you know it, so you should know its potential release details and what to expect from it.

Mega Rising was the culmination of one year of Pokémon TCG Pocket. B1 brought us full circle and did so with a huge collection of cards that will take weeks to collect. Creatures Inc. and DeNA have been easing up slightly on the new sets—with Deluxe Pack ex proving to be a rest point for some.

Pokémon TCG Pocket is going to drop Set B1a in the future, and it might be wise to have Hourglasses ready.

When Is The Next Pokémon TCG Pocket Set?

According to various sources, Pokémon TCG Pocket Set B1a isn’t arriving until December 17.

If this is correct, this means we aren’t getting a new Pokémon TCG Pocket set in November 2025. This would mirror what happened in Pocket’s first year. Genetic Apex was the debut set for the game, and Set 1a didn’t arrive until toward the end of December 2024—giving everyone two months to try and complete the collection.

Leaks suggest the plan is the same for Pokémon TCG Pocket in 2025. Mega Rising will carry over into December 2025, presumably due to the size of the set (over 300 new cards is a lot).

Then, a new, as yet unnamed, set will drop at the end of December 2025, giving everyone some festive cheer.

What Can We Expect From Pokémon TCG Pocket B1a?

Pokémon TCG Pocket B1a is likely to be a mini-set featuring a much smaller assortment of cards.

Because it’s so far away, we haven’t seen or heard any B1a leaks. Conversely, it’s common sense that the next set will follow in the footsteps of other sets that end with an “a” or a “b.” Genetic Apex was followed up by Mythical Island, which only added 86 cards.

Triumphant Light (A2a) included 96 cards, and Shining Revelry (A2b) had 112 cards, for example. While each new set is growing bigger—thanks to Shinies and other special designs—B1a will probably have between 100-120 new cards—including Rares.

Keep checking Insider Gaming for more updates on Pokémon TCG Pocket’s next set (B1a) and on the game in general. Another way to keep up with Pokémon and the site is through the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server.

If you’re a big Pokémon fan, you should definitely check out other content on IG. This includes a detailed hub chronicling the journey and details of Pokémon Ascended Heroes And Its Release Date And Cards, plus an in-depth hub on Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimension—the Switch 2 game’s first DLC.

MOBILE APP

item.title: Our Favorite Xbox 360 Games Ever
item.content:encoded:
The Xbox 360 turns 20 on November 22, and it had many at Insider Gaming thinking about the time spent with Microsoft’s most popular console. From experiencing titles like Grand Theft Auto 5 for the first time to the peak of the Halo franchise, there were no shortage of great games released on the Xbox 360 that went on to become lifelong favorites.

So, some of the staff at Insider Gaming decided to have a little fun and put together lists of their favorite Xbox 360 games. Now, no one is saying these are the best games on the system. These are just the ones everyone had the most fun playing when they came out.

It’s always fun to look back at what was loved. And who knows, maybe there’s a game you might have forgot about that you want to revisit or play for the first time. Check out the staff’s favorites and leave your thoughts in the comments and over in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Xbox 360 anniversary coverage, check out the best-selling games on the platform.

Insider Gaming’s Favorite Xbox 360 Games

Want more Insider Gaming delivered right to your inbox? Sign up today for the free weekly newsletter!

The Best-Selling Xbox 360 Games of All Time

The Xbox 360 is now 20 years old and has seen its share of classics, but what are the best-selling Xbox 360 games of all time?

Love Them or Hate Them, Extraction Shooters Are Running Wild Right Now

With the arrival of ARC Raiders, the success of Duckov, and the imminent release of Tarkov, extraction shooters are going nuts right now.

ARC Raiders is the Perfect Extraction Shooter for Gamers Who Don’t Play Extraction Shooters

ARC Raiders is, without any doubt, the best extraction shooter for those totally new to or afraid of the genre. Find out why here.

Battlefield 6 is Great, But There’s Still One Feature I Want Back

Battlefield 6 is proving to be the best thing to happen to the series in a decade, but there’s one feature I’m still hurting for.

item.title: Controversial Kirby Air Riders Bikini Skin Has Already Been Removed
item.content:encoded:
Kirby Air Riders allows you to customize special skins and sell them for in-game currency. One skin has taken it too far, and the already-infamous bikini skin has been rendered unavailable on the Kirby Air Riders Machine Market.

Sometimes you need to take a step back and realise what you’re saying and typing. But it’s all true: A controversial customizable bikini skin is no longer obtainable in Kirby Air Riders. The humorous but risqué outfit can no longer be bought, and it’s probably a warning to all players that you need to tread carefully with any sus designs.

Kirby Air Riders Bikini Skin Is Now Unavailable

Within 24 hours of the game coming out, users were making eye-opening skins and selling them on the game’s Machine Market. Everything is bought and traded using the game’s currency.

One particular skin went viral very quickly: A design showing Chef Kawasaki wearing a micro-bikini. If you didn’t know, Chef Kawasaki is a regular character in the Kirby universe, and their default getup is usually just some kind of cooking apron.

According to Automaton: “Chef Kawasaki wearing a micro bikini has been a running joke among a portion of Japanese Kirby fans for quite a few years. The headcanon seems to have resulted from fans looking at Chef Kawasaki’s standard attire – naked save for a single apron – and thinking, ‘Isn’t that kind of lewd?'”

So, once you give players the appropriate tools, they are sure to create inappropriate outfits. Kirby Air Riders’ technology finally allowed the Chef Kawasaki bikini look to happen.

Have you rinsed your eyes yet? Well, it only took hours for the design to be removed.

It was fun while it lasted, but this dual-wields as both an action and a warning to Kirby Air Riders players: Think twice before putting Chef Kawasaki—or anyone, for that matter—in a micro-bikini and selling it on the Machine Market.

Have you seen any other bizarre or hilarious outfits in the Kirby Air Riders Machine Market? Feel free to share them through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Check out the Hytale Price Being Revealed Ahead of Early Access Release and Battlefield 6’s New Map Having A Secret Breaking Bad Easter Egg for more fun news and content.
